meanings.definition: The action of emphasizing or making something more noticeable.
meanings.sent1: Her accentuation of the key points in the presentation made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: The accentuation of the bright colors in the painting drew everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The accentuation of the cat's whiskers with tiny bows was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The accentuation of the mountain peak against the sunset was truly breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The accentuation of the music with the drum beats made the performance unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The act of pronouncing a word with stress or emphasis on a particular syllable.
meanings.sent1: His accentuation of the last syllable in the word 'elephant' was very clear.
meanings.sent2: The accentuation of the first syllable in 'banana' is important for correct pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The accentuation of the word 'butterfly' on the wrong syllable sounded quite funny.
meanings.sent4: Her accentuation of the word 'impossible' on the first syllable was like a hammer hitting a nail.
meanings.sent5: The accentuation of the word 'celebrate' on the second syllable made it stand out in the sentence.
